data.title: Royal Academy of Arts
data.meta_description: The Royal Academy of Arts, located in the heart of London, is a place where art is made, exhibited and debated.
data.text:
Thomas John Gullick

Painting Popularly Explained: Including Fresco, Tempera, Encaustic, Miniature, Oil, Mosaic, Water-Colour, Missal, Painting on Pottery, Porcelain, Enamel, Glass, &c. With Historical Sketches of the Progress of the Art. By Thomas John Gullick, Painter, And John Timbs, F.S.A. Author Of "Curiosities Of London." - London:: [1859]

06/1891
